clineRules.title: Manage Parrot Rules & Workflows

descriptions.rules: Rules let you give Parrot system-level guidance. Think of it as a persistent way to include context and preferences for your project or globally per conversation.
descriptions.workflows: Workflows let you define a sequence of steps to guide Parrot through a sequence of repeatable tasks, like deploying a service or committing a PR. To invoke a workflow in chat, type /workflow-name.
descriptions.skills: Skills are reusable sets of instructions Parrot can activate on demand. When a task matches a skill's description, Parrot uses the use_skill tool to load the full instructions.
descriptions.hooks: Hooks allow you to execute custom scripts at specific points in Parrot's execution lifecycle, enabling automation and integration with external tools.

clineRules.windowsWarning: Hooks toggling is not supported on Windows. Hooks can be created, edited, and deleted, but not enabled/disabled and will not execute.
